Comment.name: Top Node
Comment.#text: The Top Node links nodes that lack a parent.

Comment.name: _1.HIS + HSCP, ident + coord
Comment.#text: Support Healthcare Improvement Scotland in providing Health and Social Care Partnerships with expertise on testing and implementing improvements in the identification and care co-ordination of those who can benefit from palliative and end of life care.

Comment.name: _2. strategic commissioning
Comment.#text: Provide strategic commissioning guidance on palliative and end of life care to Health and Social Care Partnerships.

Comment.name: _3. educational framework
Comment.#text: Support the development of a new palliative and end of life care educational framework.

Comment.name: _4. care for 0-25yos
Comment.#text: Support and promote the further development of holistic palliative care for the 0-25 years age group.

Comment.name: _5. research forum
Comment.#text: Support the establishment of the Scottish Research Forum for Palliative and End of Life Care.

Comment.name: _6. culture change
Comment.#text: Support greater public and personal discussion of bereavement, death, dying and care at the end of life, partly through commissioning work to facilitate this.

Comment.name: _7. electronic care planning
Comment.#text: Seek to ensure that future requirements of e-Health systems support the effective sharing of individual end of life and Anticipatory Care Planning conversations.

Comment.name: _8. economic and effectivness evaluations
Comment.#text: Support clinical and health economic evaluations of palliative and end of life care models.

Comment.name: _9. data
Comment.#text: Support improvements in the collection, analysis, interpretation and dissemination of data and evidence relating to needs, provision, activity, indicators and outcomes in respect of palliative and end of life care.

Comment.name: _10. NIAG
Comment.#text: Establish a new National Implementation Support Group to support the implementation of improvement actions.

Comment.name: _11. funding review
Comment.#text: Review hospice funding, in particular the differing levels for adult and children's hospices

Comment.name: SFA PEOLC
Comment.#text: Within the Scottish Government team we are endeavouring to use the principles of the semantically enabled web to ensure that work on the strategic framework for action of palliative and end of life care links up with work on-going elsewhere and with other government programs.

Comment.name: quantitative and qualitative data
Comment.#text: availability of meaningful quantitative and qualitative data including comparative data

Comment.name: effective data use
Comment.#text: developing capacity and capability for effective analysis, interpretation and application of data

Comment.name: outputs - evidence informed
Comment.#text: developing evidence informed outputs to support service provision and redesign

Comment.name: knowledge exchange
Comment.#text: knowledge exchange of what works to inform policy and practice

Comment.name: research+monitoring+evaluation processes
Comment.#text: developing robust research and monitoring and evaluation to improve understanding of interventions which work in particular circumstances

Comment.name: national workforce contracts
Comment.#text: ensuring national workforce contracts support the needs of integrated health and social care services

Comment.name: pre-registration training
Comment.#text: ensuring pre-registration training supports the development of professionals skilled to work across integrated services

Comment.name: training development programmes+resources
Comment.#text: ensure training and development programmes and resources in place which support a workforce with the knowledge and skills to deliver the 2020 vision and the Vision and Strategy for Social Services

Comment.name: health+social care workers
Comment.#text: support to enable all those working in health and social care services whether as managers or frontline practitioners to embrace outcomes-focused practice

Comment.name: national workforce data
Comment.#text: provides meaningful national workforce data that supports the work of redesign

Comment.name: local level workforce planning
Comment.#text: support HSCP to undertake workforce planning at a local level, developing a whole system approach

Comment.name: professional regulation
Comment.#text: ensure professional regulation is enacted in a way that is supportive of the delivery of integrated services, but maintains public assurance and rigour

Comment.name: multidisciplinary working models
Comment.#text: support the testing of new models of multidisciplinary working and ensure learning captured and spread across different settings

Comment.name: knowledge+skills+confidence
Comment.#text: development of knowledge, skills and confidence to effectively lead and implement transformational redesign

Comment.name: consult citizens
Comment.#text: consultation with citizens in the design and delivery of services

Comment.name: consult on service provision design
Comment.#text: work with GP clusters, TSIs and other bodies to inform the design of service provision

Comment.name: knowledge+skills development
Comment.#text: development of the knowledge and skills to effectively lead the work of improvement and large scale change

Comment.name: self-evaluation
Comment.#text: self-evaluation of their performance and key development priorities

Comment.name: community engagement
Comment.#text: encouraging individuals receiving care, their families and wider communities to engage in the work of improvement

Comment.name: long-term plans+approaches development
Comment.#text: long-term plans and approaches designed to deliver new, transformational, models of care and support

Comment.name: new ways of working
Comment.#text: ensure that evidence-based new ways of working are implemented in their areas

Comment.name: coaching support provision
Comment.#text: coaching support to enable effective leadership of change and effective leadership of integrated services

Comment.name: national networks facilitation
Comment.#text: national networks to enable learning to be quickly transferred across the system

Comment.name: guidance+support provision
Comment.#text: providing guidance and support to enable effective performance management

Comment.name: National Performance measures
Comment.#text: National Performance measures which enable effective performance management

Comment.name: strategic leadership development
Comment.#text: developing strategic leadership that sets a compelling vision and challenges and transforms existing services to better meet the needs expressed by individuals and communities

Comment.name: existing technology infrastructure
Comment.#text: effective use of existing technology infrastructure to support integration

Comment.name: web+digital service development
Comment.#text: collaboration with stakeholders to use and further develop existing national and local web and digital services to maximum effect and in support of best practice

Comment.name: care applications+services dissemination
Comment.#text: adopting, spreading and embedding technology-enabled care applications and services

Comment.name: technological care solution development
Comment.#text: connecting with digital and technology providers to innovate and test new technology-enabled care solutions

Comment.name: good practice+innovation development
Comment.#text: learn from, and reflect on, good practice and innovations from other parts of the system as well as those within the field of health and social care

Comment.name: procurement process implementation
Comment.#text: Support HSCPs to implement new procurement processes in ways that enable collaborative service delivery, where this provides the best value and outcomes

Comment.name: knowledge+skills+expertise of partners
Comment.#text: Support HSCPs to fully utilise the knowledge, skills and expertise across their partners

Comment.name: performance frameworks
Comment.#text: Leaders are enabled and supported to develop performance frameworks that best meet the local needs of those to whom they are reporting cf CE Act and to challenge performance reporting that does not support this aim

Comment.name: reviewing local impact +feedback
Comment.#text: Support to HandSCP partnerships to develop local approaches to evaluating impact and feedback in to partnerships

Comment.name: service user collaboratoin
Comment.#text: Support HandSCP to listen to, and work with people who use services, including in response to complaints, concerns and feedback

Comment.name: good practice+innovations review
Comment.#text: Support HSCPs to learn from, and reflect on, good practice and innovations from other parts of the system as well as those within the field of health and social care

Comment.name: Source
Comment.#text: Health and Social Care Data Integration and Intelligence Project HSCDIIP data platform run by ISD, including the Tableau dashboard system for partnerships to access information to support them with their strategic plans in relation to Health and Social Care Integration

Comment.name: Local Intelligence Support Team LIST
Comment.#text: Initiative run by ISD - places information specialists to work on-site with Health and Social Care Partnerships, Community Planning Partnerships and Local Authorities

Comment.name: Scottish Public Health Observatory ScotPHO
Comment.#text: Collaboration co-led by ISD Scotland and NHS Health Scotland, aiming to provide a clear picture of the health of the Scottish population and the factors that affect it

Comment.id: Scottish Primary Care Information Resource SPIRE
Comment.name: Scottish Primary Care Information Resource SPIRE
Comment.#text: service that will allow small amounts of information from GP practice records to be used to help doctors' surgeries, NHSScotland and the Scottish Government to improve care and plan services, and to help researchers to learn more from patient information held at GP practices

Comment.name: NSS IT services
Comment.#text: storing, linking, enabling and managing NHSS and HSCI data and processes

Comment.id: development of a common, core dataset
Comment.name: development of a common, core dataset
Comment.#text: Researching potential to develop a common, core dataset based on local measures and indicators, for benchmarking purposes, drawn from each of the Integrated Health and Social Care Partnerships HSCBN

Comment.name: ALISS integration pilot work
Comment.#text: A Local Information System for Scotland ALISS integration pilot work for using 3rd sector data ALLIANCE

Comment.name: Threading the Needle work
Comment.#text: Threading the Needle work being undertaken by Evaluation Support Scotland ALLIANCE

Comment.name: Evidence Databases
Comment.#text: Evidence Databases available through The Knowledge Network subscription content NES

Comment.id: Information Sharing Tool-kitandPublic Benefit and Privacy Panel
Comment.name: Information Sharing Tool-kitandPublic Benefit and Privacy Panel
Comment.#text: In 2015 an Information Sharing Tool-kit for Scotland was launched and a Public Benefit and Privacy Panel for NHS Scotland created. These provide guidance for IJBs requiring to create information sharing agreements, and a route for IG issues not answered by the guidance to be resolved. SG eHealth

Comment.id: development of a common, core dataset
Comment.name: development of a common, core dataset
Comment.#text: Researching potential to develop a common, core dataset based on local measures and indicators, for benchmarking purposes, drawn from each of the Integrated Health and Social Care Partnerships (HSCBN)

Comment.name: ALISS integration pilot work
Comment.#text: A Local Information System for Scotland (ALISS) integration pilot work for using 3rd sector data (ALLIANCE)

Comment.name: Threading the Needle work
Comment.#text: Threading the Needle work being undertaken by Evaluation Support Scotland (ALLIANCE)

Comment.name: Evidence Databases
Comment.#text: Evidence Databases available through The Knowledge Network subscription content (NES)

Comment.id: Information Sharing Tool-kit / Public Benefit and Privacy Panel
Comment.name: Public Benefit and Privacy Panel
Comment.#text: In 2015 an Information Sharing Tool-kit for Scotland was launched and a Public Benefit and Privacy Panel for NHS Scotland created. These provide guidance for IJBs requiring to create information sharing agreements, and a route for IG issues not answered by the guidance to be resolved. (SG e-health)
